annotation_1.eng: Point out the vivid colors -- the yellow sun, the blue sky, the green bushes, and the red shoes.

annotation_2.eng: Count the two bushes and the two red shoes with your child.

annotation_3.eng: Point out how uncomfortable the man looks bending over so far to hoe.

rows.annotation_1: Point out the vivid colors -- the yellow sun, the blue sky, the green bushes, and the red shoes.
rows.annotation_2: Count the two bushes and the two red shoes with your child.
rows.annotation_3: Point out how uncomfortable the man looks bending over so far to hoe.

annotation_1.eng: Comment that the doorway is too low -- the man is taller than the door.

annotation_2.eng: Look how much the man stoops down to talk to the boy -- he is much taller than the boy, and the boy is much shorter than the man!

rows.annotation_1: Comment that the doorway is too low -- the man is taller than the door.
rows.annotation_2: Look how much the man stoops down to talk to the boy -- he is much taller than the boy, and the boy is much shorter than the man!

annotation_1.eng: The man's legs stick far out of the bed. He is much longer than his bed.

annotation_2.eng: Point to the bird and the boy and how puzzled they look by the short bed.

annotation_3.eng: Count together the toes on each of the man's feet.

rows.annotation_1: The man's legs stick far out of the bed. He is much longer than his bed.
rows.annotation_2: Point to the bird and the boy and how puzzled they look by the short bed.
rows.annotation_3: Count together the toes on each of the man's feet.

annotation_1.eng: The tall man is much too big for his bicycle. Look how far his leg sticks out!

annotation_2.eng: Point out that the bird has changed color from yellow to orange!

annotation_3.eng: Where is the boy in this picture?

rows.annotation_1: The tall man is much too big for his bicycle. Look how far his leg sticks out!
rows.annotation_2: Point out that the bird has changed color from yellow to orange!
rows.annotation_3: Where is the boy in this picture?

rows.story_text:
This man was too tall!

What can he do to solve his problem and fit into his world?

story_text.eng:
This man was too tall!

What can he do to solve his problem and fit into his world?

annotation_1.eng: Maybe the man is not too tall -- maybe he just needs to solve his problems!

annotation_2.eng: The man has a problem and he is feeling sad about it.

annotation_3.eng: Notice that this man is much taller than the other people.

rows.annotation_1: Maybe the man is not too tall -- maybe he just needs to solve his problems!
rows.annotation_2: The man has a problem and he is feeling sad about it.
rows.annotation_3: Notice that this man is much taller than the other people.

rows.story_text: He made a very long handle.

story_text.eng: He made a very long handle.

annotation_1.eng: He solved his problem with the hoe! He made his hoe bigger!

annotation_2.eng: Which one is bigger, the hoe or the man?

annotation_3.eng: Do you see the man's red shoes? They disappeared!

rows.annotation_1: He solved his problem with the hoe! He made his hoe bigger!
rows.annotation_2: Which one is bigger, the hoe or the man?
rows.annotation_3: Do you see the man's red shoes? They disappeared!

rows.story_text: He made very high door frames.

story_text.eng: He made very high door frames.

annotation_1.eng: Which is higher -- the door or the man?

annotation_2.eng: The sun in the sky is round. Point to round things where you are.

annotation_3.eng: Which is longer and which is shorter -- the man's legs or his upper body?

rows.annotation_1: Which is higher -- the door or the man?
rows.annotation_2: The sun in the sky is round. Point to round things where you are.
rows.annotation_3: Which is longer and which is shorter -- the man's legs or his upper body?

rows.story_text: He made a very long bed.

story_text.eng: He made a very long bed.

annotation_1.eng: We can't see the man's feet now. His bed is longer than he is.

annotation_2.eng: The man looks very comfortable and happy in his big bed.

annotation_3.eng: Look at how small the boy looks next to the bed!

rows.annotation_1: We can't see the man's feet now. His bed is longer than he is.
rows.annotation_2: The man looks very comfortable and happy in his big bed.
rows.annotation_3: Look at how small the boy looks next to the bed!

rows.story_text: He bought a very high bicycle.

story_text.eng: He bought a very high bicycle.

annotation_1.eng: Notice that the boy and the bird are inside the basket now.

annotation_2.eng: Everyone looks very happy now that the man's things are the right size.

annotation_3.eng: Point to and name the many different colors on this page.

rows.annotation_1: Notice that the boy and the bird are inside the basket now.
rows.annotation_2: Everyone looks very happy now that the man's things are the right size.
rows.annotation_3: Point to and name the many different colors on this page.

rows.story_text: He sat on a very high chair. He ate with a very long fork.

story_text.eng: He sat on a very high chair. He ate with a very long fork.

annotation_1.eng: Count out with your child many of the things in the picture -- such as fingers, legs, steps, and tines.

annotation_2.eng: Look at how high the boy's chair is! Would you be scared sitting so high?

annotation_3.eng: Now that all his things are the right size for him, the man is not too tall at all!

rows.annotation_1: Count out with your child many of the things in the picture -- such as fingers, legs, steps, and tines.
rows.annotation_2: Look at how high the boy's chair is! Would you be scared sitting so high?
rows.annotation_3: Now that all his things are the right size for him, the man is not too tall at all!

rows.story_text: He left his house and moved to a big house in the forest, where he lived for many years.

story_text.eng: He left his house and moved to a big house in the forest, where he lived for many years.

annotation_1.eng: Count the pineapples, bags, and trees with your child.

annotation_2.eng: Count the rungs on the ladder with your child.

annotation_3.eng: Notice that the bird is yellow again!

rows.annotation_1: Count the pineapples, bags, and trees with your child.
rows.annotation_2: Count the rungs on the ladder with your child.
rows.annotation_3: Notice that the bird is yellow again!
